patterns.comment: after literal-function, which includes some prototype strings
flowtype vars with a : to indicate type
these statements must end in a ;
flowtype objects {a,b,{z}} with a : to indicate type
these statements must end in a ;
flowtype arrays [a,[b,c]] with a : to indicate type
these statements must end in a ;
var statements that done start with a flow indicator
patterns.name: storage.type.js

jsx.comment: Uses the JSX syntax as decribed at http://facebook.github.io/jsx/
together with the Unicode Spec http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr31/
but excludes using unicode esc characters, <ZWNJ> and <ZWJ> as per the draft. Will anyone use these?

patterns.comment: Trap tag <JSXElementName Where JSXElement Name = aaa.bbb
We use the tag name to form a completion for </JSXElementName>
as well as terminating a <JSXElementName /> form
Tags that end > are trapped in #jsx-tag-termination
patterns.name: meta.tag.jsx

patterns.comment: this matches the end > of an opening tag when in the form <tag> </tag>
uses non consuming search for </ in </tag>
non named flowtype returing a type T e.g. function x(arg, arg): T {} :
handled thus to avoid a function body brace being treated as an object literal type
maybe an issue if a object literal is returned and the start of func block isn't on same line!
name of variable spread var or optional ? var with flowtype :

flowtype-destruct-lhs.comment: use this pattern to colour code the variable part correctly

patterns.comment: prop name : var name as destructor target
name of property which can be a string
call back with a form  ) => type
patterns.name: storage.type.function.arrow.js

patterns.comment: some form of default assignment for func args
as per React declares in flowtype github
patterns.name: kewyword.operator.existential.flowtype

patterns.comment: Get parameters within a function/method call
Built-in Class Types with elements of type <T>
just the polymorph bit like this <K,V>(arg,arg)

flowtype-parse-objects.comment: object literal flowtype not be preceded by either  : | = symbols

flowtype-parse-array.comment: arrays such as [name: string, dob: Date]

flowtype-class-fields.comment: flow supports field names in classe bodies, such as  namevar: string

patterns.comment: find declare module and declare class defs

flowtype-class-name.comment: look for classes names but dont assume uppercase start char
flowtype-class-name.name: entity.name.class.js

flowtype-interface-name.comment: look for interface names but dont assume uppercase start char
flowtype-interface-name.name: support.type.interface.js
